articles.title: Ocean of Stakes: The Western Indian Ocean’s complex maritime order
articles.summary: Europe's economic prosperity relies heavily on secure global maritime routes, particularly the Western Indian Ocean (WIO). This crucial corridor connects vital Gulf energy supplies with Asian manufacturing, making it indispensable for European economies. Maintaining stability and security in the WIO is paramount for ensuring continuous trade flow, safeguarding Europe's economic interests, and upholding its strategic global connectivity.

articles.title: Karnataka’s spacetech policy to offer Rs 1 crore for testing support

The policy aims to establish Space Manufacturing Parks via public-private partnerships, fostering a dynamic ecosystem for space startups, research, and innovation. This initiative positions Karnataka as a key contributor to India's burgeoning space economy, promoting technological advancement and job creation within the sector.

articles.title: What’s up with… Orange & Skylo, Iliad, OpCore

Concurrently, Iliad's cloud unit is expanding its operations. This industry news reflects ongoing growth and technological evolution within the telecommunications and cloud computing sectors, pointing towards enhanced digital connectivity and service offerings in the region.

articles.title: Retired professor, 75, fumbled to learn her finances when her husband died. What to do before a catastrophe strikes
articles.summary: Alice Stone Nakhimovsky's husband, Alexander, died unexpectedly from a brain aneurysm, leaving her, at 75, without her partner and crucially, without any details of their shared financial life. This personal tragedy underscores the significant challenges and potential financial disarray faced by individuals when a spouse passes without clear financial arrangements, highlighting the importance of marital financial transparency.

articles.title: End of the Year: Let’s Look at Taxes, Metals and Energy
articles.summary: Locomotive engineers prioritize stopping trains early over risking an overshoot, highlighting safety in railway operations. articles.title: We can finally hear the long-hidden music of the Stone Age

It highlights an ancient understanding of subterranean environments, suggesting artistic or ritualistic applications of acoustic phenomena in prehistoric societies.

articles.title: Jet fighter maintenance parts, bombs shipped to Israel via U.S., groups say in new report

articles.title: The Day the Internet Died: How an Underwater Cable Cut Plunged a Nation Into Digital Darkness
articles.summary: An underwater volcanic eruption near Tonga initiated a powerful cascade of debris, severing the island nation's sole international communication cable. This significant natural disaster critically disrupted Tonga's global connectivity, highlighting the immense vulnerability of vital infrastructure to geological events and their far-reaching consequences for island nations.

articles.title: The Day the Internet Died: How an Underwater Cable Cut Plunged a Nation Into Digital Darkness
articles.summary: An underwater volcanic eruption near Tonga caused debris to cascade into the ocean, severing Tonga's sole international fiber optic cable. This significant natural disaster, originating from the volcano's powerful eruption, plunged the island nation into isolation, disrupting vital communication links and highlighting infrastructure vulnerability.

articles.title: Sweden’s Saab offers to build entire GlobalEye military surveillance plane in Canada
articles.summary: Swedish defence giant Saab has proposed its GlobalEye airborne surveillance system to Canada. This bid supplements Saab's prior offer to create Canadian jobs if Ottawa procures Gripen fighter jets. The move highlights Saab's strategy to secure significant defence contracts by linking military sales with economic benefits for Canada, influencing key procurement decisions for its armed forces.

articles.title: Deeptech to account for up to one-third of VC funding in India: Accel’s Prashanth Prakash

This trend signals a robust future for indigenous innovation and economic development.

Turkey has previously acted as a mediator, and Zelenskyy's visit underscores ongoing international efforts to de-escalate the protracted war and seek a diplomatic way forward.

articles.title: How a Dutch “Dementia Village” Improves Quality of Life with Intentional Design
articles.summary: Dementia patients progressively lose the ability to actively engage in conversations, manage daily activities, and maintain personal upkeep. Understanding these cognitive and behavioural changes is crucial for providing effective care and support, ensuring the well-being and dignity of those affected by this degenerative condition.

This highlights the escalating strategic competition and evolving geopolitical dynamics in the Indo-Pacific region, crucial for understanding global security challenges.

articles.title: North Korea says Seoul-US sub deal will trigger 'nuclear domino' effect
articles.summary: North Korea has strongly condemned a recent agreement between South Korea and the United States to develop nuclear-powered submarines. Pyongyang views this deal as a dangerous step towards nuclear dominance, threatening regional stability and escalating an arms race in the Korean Peninsula. This highlights persistent geopolitical tensions and strategic competition in the region.

articles.title: Boost to warfighting readiness as Britain's aircraft carrier fully 'mission ready' and committed to NATO for the first time
